class.name: DiscordppActivity

method.name: AddButton
method.description: Adds a custom button to the rich presence

method.name: ApplicationId
method.description: The application ID of the game that the activity is associated with. This field cannot be set by the SDK, and will always be the application ID of the current game or a game from the same publisher. Returns [int] or [code]null[/code].

method.name: Assets
method.description: Images used to customize how the Activity is displayed in the Discord client. Returns [DiscordppActivityAssets] or [code]null[/code].

method.name: Details
method.description: The state _of the what the user is doing_ for this activity. See the docs on the Activity struct for more info. If specified, must be a string between 2 and 128 characters. Returns [String] or [code]null[/code].

method.name: DetailsUrl
method.description: A URL that opens when the user clicks/taps the details text. See the docs on the Activity struct for more info. If specified, must be a string between 2 and 256 characters. Returns [String] or [code]null[/code].

method.name: Equals
method.description: Compares each field of the Activity struct for equality.

method.name: GetButtons
method.description: Returns the custom buttons for the rich presence

method.name: Name
method.description: The name of the game or application that the activity is associated with. This field defaults to the name of the current game.

method.name: ParentApplicationId
method.description: The application ID of the parent application that the activity is associated with if it exists. This is to help identify a collection of games that are from the same publisher. This field cannot be set by the SDK, and will always be the application ID of the game's parent or unset if the game has no parent. Returns [int] or [code]null[/code].

method.name: Party
method.description: The party struct is used to indicate the size and members of the people the current user is playing with. Returns [DiscordppActivityParty] or [code]null[/code].

method.name: Secrets
method.description: The secrets struct is used in combination with the party struct to make an Activity joinable. Returns [DiscordppActivitySecrets] or [code]null[/code].

method.name: SetAssets

method.description: Setter for Activity::StatusDisplayType. Where [param StatusDisplayType] is [enum DiscordppStatusDisplayTypes.Enum] or [code]null[/code].

method.name: State
method.description: The state _of the party_ for this activity. See the docs on the Activity struct for more info. If specified, must be a string between 2 and 128 characters. Returns [String] or [code]null[/code].

method.name: StateUrl
method.description: A URL that opens when the user clicks/taps the state text. See the docs on the Activity struct for more info. If specified, must be a string between 2 and 256 characters. Returns [String] or [code]null[/code].

method.name: StatusDisplayType
method.description: Controls which field is used for the user's status message See the docs on the Activity struct for more info. Returns [enum DiscordppStatusDisplayTypes.Enum] or [code]null[/code].

method.name: SupportedPlatforms
method.description: If an activity is joinable, but only on certain platforms, this field can be used to indicate which platforms the activity is joinable on. For example if a game is available on both PC and Mobile, but PC users cannot join Mobile users and vice versa, this field can be used so that an activity only shows as joinable on Discord if the user is on the appropriate platform.

method.name: Timestamps
method.description: The timestamps struct can be used to render either: [br]- a "time remaining" countdown timer (by specifying the `end` value) [br]- a "time elapsed" countup timer (by specifying the `start` value) Returns [DiscordppActivityTimestamps] or [code]null[/code].

method.name: Type
method.description: The type of activity this is. This should almost always be set to `Playing`
